transportAdvice: Port of Spain has a public bus network and shared minibus taxis (known locally as maxi-taxis) that cover most areas, though services can be infrequent and routes may be confusing for first-time visitors; private taxis are widely available and recommended for tourists, especially at night. Walking is practical in the city center during daytime but less advisable after dark or in unfamiliar neighborhoods.

weather.description: Dry season is well underway with sunny skies, low humidity, and pleasant breezes making this one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Carnival season typically falls in February, bringing vibrant festivities alongside dry, warm, and festive conditions.
Warm and dry with plenty of sunshine, making it an excellent month for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
Temperatures begin to climb toward their peak and conditions remain largely dry, though occasional showers may appear late in the month.
The transition into the wet season begins, with increasing afternoon showers and rising humidity alongside warm temperatures.
Wet season is in full swing with frequent heavy showers, high humidity, and overcast skies common throughout the day.
Rain continues regularly and humidity remains high, though mornings can be bright before afternoon downpours arrive.
One of the wetter months of the year with persistent showers and lush green landscapes across the island.
Rain remains frequent and the island sits within the Atlantic hurricane season, though Trinidad is generally south of the main hurricane belt.
Still firmly in the wet season with heavy intermittent rain and warm, muggy conditions persisting through the month.
Rainfall begins to ease toward the end of the month as the dry season approaches, though showers remain common.
The dry season returns with more reliable sunshine, lower humidity, and comfortable temperatures ideal for travel.
